summary: This is a civil complaint filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York by an anonymous plaintiff against Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn, the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The plaintiff alleges she was sexually abused by Epstein as a minor as part of his New York-based sex-trafficking enterprise and brings claims for battery, assault, and intentional infliction of emotional distress.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of operating a criminal sex-trafficking enterprise from his New York townhouse and sexually abusing the plaintiff when she was a minor.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.role: Executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, Defendant
persons.context: Named as a defendant in his capacity as an executor of Epstein's estate, deemed liable for Epstein's acts.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.role: Executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, Defendant
persons.context: Named as a defendant in his capacity as an executor of Epstein's estate, deemed liable for Epstein's acts.

persons.name: Mariann Meier Wang
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP who signed the complaint on behalf of the plaintiff.

persons.name: Daniel Mullkoff
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP listed as representing the plaintiff.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney from Allred, Maroko & Goldberg listed as representing the plaintiff.

connections.description: Indyke is an executor of Epstein's estate, making him legally responsible for the estate's liabilities.
Kahn is an executor of Epstein's estate, making him legally responsible for the estate's liabilities.
Co-executors of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, jointly named as defendants in the lawsuit.
Wang is an attorney representing the anonymous plaintiff in the lawsuit.
Allred is an attorney representing the anonymous plaintiff in the lawsuit.

events.title: Filing of Civil Complaint
events.description: An anonymous plaintiff files a civil lawsuit against the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, alleging sexual abuse when she was a minor.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York County.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's townhouse)
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York County
United States Virgin Islands (Epstein's domicile at death)
keyFacts: The plaintiff is an anonymous individual who alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein as a minor child.
The complaint describes Epstein's New York townhouse at 9 East 71st Street as the 'epicenter' of a criminal sex-trafficking enterprise used to recruit and traffic minor girls.
The lawsuit is filed against the estate's executors, Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn, under New York's Child Victims Act (CPLR 214-g), which provided a one-year lookback window for such claims.
The legal claims include battery, assault, and intentional infliction of emotional distress, seeking compensatory and punitive damages.
The document states Epstein was domiciled in the U.S. Virgin Islands at the time of his death and was residing in the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York when he died.
